question: Unlike the gymnosperms where the ovules are _______, in the angiosperms or flowering plants, the pollen grains and ovules are developed in specialised structures called flowers.
In angiosperms or flowering plants, the pollen grains and ovules are developed in specialised structures called _______.

Angiosperms occur in a wide range of _______.
Angiosperms range in size from the smallest _______ to tall trees of Eucalyptus.
Eucalyptus can grow over _______ metres in height.
Angiosperms provide us with food, fodder, fuel, _______ and several other commercially important products.
Angiosperms provide us with food, fodder, fuel, medicines and several other commercially important _______.
Angiosperms are divided into two classes: the _______ and the monocotyledons.
Angiosperms are divided into two classes: the dicotyledons and the _______.
The tall trees of _______ can reach over 100 metres.
In gymnosperms, the ovules are described as _______.
In angiosperms, pollen grains and ovules are developed in structures called _______.
The seeds of _______ are enclosed in fruits.
Angiosperms provide us with food, ______, fuel, medicines and several other commercially important products.
Angiosperms provide us with ______, fodder, fuel, medicines and several other commercially important products.
Angiosperms provide us with food, fodder, ______, medicines and several other commercially important products.
